home.faq_subtitle: Quick answers to common questions about PC bottlenecks and performance issues.

faqs.a: A PC bottleneck happens when one component limits the performance of the whole system. For example, even with a high-end GPU, a weaker CPU may prevent it from reaching full potential.

faqs.q: Is a CPU or GPU bottleneck worse?
faqs.a: For gaming, a mild GPU bottleneck is usually fine because it means your graphics card is working fully. A strong CPU bottleneck is worse, as it often causes stuttering and inconsistent frame rates.

faqs.q: How accurate is the bottleneck calculator?
faqs.a: Our PC Bottleneck Calculator uses data-driven estimates to provide a highly reliable analysis. Still, real-world results can vary depending on games, applications, and driver updates.

faqs.q: Do RAM or storage also cause bottlenecks?
faqs.a: Yes. Insufficient or slow RAM can cause stutters in heavy workloads. Similarly, using an HDD instead of an SSD will lead to slower loading times.

faqs.q: Should CPU and GPU both run at 100%?
faqs.a: Ideally, your GPU should be close to full utilization for gaming. CPU usage will vary, and itâ€™s not always ideal for it to hit 100%. If CPU is maxed out but GPU is underutilized, thatâ€™s a clear CPU bottleneck.

about.title: About Us
about.intro_p1: Welcome to PCBuildCheck.com â€” your trusted hub for accurate, data-driven PC performance insights. Weâ€™re a team of PC builders, gamers, and developers with one mission: to make complex hardware decisions simple, explainable, and reliable.
about.intro_p2: Whether youâ€™re planning your next gaming rig, editing workstation, or a budget build, our tools help you understand performance â€” not just estimate it â€” so you can buy and upgrade with confidence.
about.mission_title: Our Mission: Clarity You Can Trust
about.mission_desc_1: Building or upgrading a PC shouldnâ€™t be a guessing game. With hundreds of CPUs, GPUs, and new hardware released every year, itâ€™s easy to get lost in specs and opinions. PCBuildCheck exists to demystify performance by combining verified benchmark data with clear explanations â€” helping you spot bottlenecks before they cost you money.
about.mission_desc_2: We believe every gamer, creator, and professional deserves a PC that performs to its full potential. Our calculators and databases empower you with informed, data-backed decisions so you get maximum performance for every dollar spent.
about.how_title: How It Works: Data + Real-World Testing
about.how_desc_1: We use a multi-layered analysis that checks CPU instructions, IPC (Instructions Per Clock), core efficiency, and cache latency against modern GPU rendering pipelines.
about.how_desc_2: Rather than a simple "bottleneck percentage," we calculate separate scores for 1080p, 1440p, and 4K gaming, giving you a clearer picture of real-world performance.
different_list: Transparency First: We explain how every estimate is calculated. See our methodology.
Built by Enthusiasts: Our algorithms are powered by real benchmarks, not marketing promises.
User-First Design: Every tool is optimized for speed, accessibility, and Core Web Vitals.
Continuous Updates: We constantly add new CPUs, GPUs, and games to stay accurate with the latest releases.
Education Over Guesswork: We help you learn why a configuration performs a certain way â€” not just how much it scores.
promise_list: Accuracy: Benchmarks and models are refined with real-world feedback.
Independence: We do not sell hardware or accept sponsored rankings.
Privacy: Calculations run client-side. We never collect or sell your personal data.
Accessibility: Our calculators are built for beginners and experts alike.
about.community_desc: PCBuildCheck is a growing community of builders, gamers, and creators. We welcome feedback, bug reports, and feature suggestions.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.intro: Your privacy matters to us. This policy explains what we collect, how we use it, and the choices you have when using PCBuildCheck.com.

sections.title: 1. Information We Collect
sections.content: We do not collect personally identifiable information unless you voluntarily provide it (for example, via our contact form or email). We automatically process limited technical data (e.g., IP address, device/browser info, pages viewed, timestamps) for security, analytics, and performance.

sections.title: 2. Cookies & Local Storage
sections.content: We use cookies/local storage for essential functionality (e.g., theme preference) and to remember calculator settings. These do not store personal data.

sections.title: Advertising cookies (if enabled)
sections.content: If we integrate third-party ads (e.g., Google AdSense), those partners may use cookies or similar technologies to show relevant ads.

sections.title: 3. Analytics
sections.content: We use privacy-respecting analytics to understand site usage and improve performance. Where applicable, we enable IP anonymization and respect regional consent requirements.

sections.title: 4. Third-Party Links & Services
sections.content: We may link to external sites (e.g., reviews, tools). Their privacy practices are their ownâ€”please review their policies when you visit them.

sections.title: 5. Your Choices & Rights
sections.content:
• Cookie preferences: Manage or withdraw consent at any time.
  • Access, correction, deletion: You may request a copy or deletion of data we hold about you (if any).

sections.title: 6. Contact Us

fps.title: How Many FPS Can My PC Run? Free Calculator & Bottleneck Tool
fps.subtitle: Estimate your average Frames Per Second (FPS) in popular games.
fps.faq_subtitle: Quick answers to common questions about estimating FPS and gaming performance.

faqs.q: How does the FPS calculator work?
faqs.a: The FPS calculator uses a database of component benchmarks and game optimization data to estimate average frames per second you can expect with your selected CPU and GPU combination.

faqs.q: Why is my actual FPS different from the calculatorâ€™s estimate?
faqs.a: Real-world FPS can vary due to factors like drivers, cooling, RAM speed, background processes, and specific in-game settings. The calculator provides a baseline estimate for most users.

faqs.q: Can I use the FPS calculator for future games?
faqs.a: While the calculator is based on current benchmark data, it can give a rough idea for upcoming titles. However, new game engines and updates may cause performance to differ.

faqs.q: Does resolution and graphics settings affect FPS results?
faqs.a: Yes. Running games at higher resolutions (1440p, 4K) or ultra settings requires more GPU power, which lowers FPS compared to playing at 1080p or medium settings.

guide.title: Understanding PC Bottlenecks: A Complete Guide to a Balanced System
guide.intro: Welcome to the ultimate resource for PC performance analysis. A bottleneck is the single most important concept to understand when building or upgrading a gaming PC. It occurs when one of your components is too slow to keep up with the others, effectively creating a "traffic jam" that limits your entire system's potential. Our PC Bottleneck Calculator is designed to instantly identify these issues for you.
guide.intro_p2: By preventing bottlenecks, you ensure that every dollar you spend on hardware translates directly into the performance you expect. A balanced PC is a powerful, efficient, and cost-effective PC.

cpu_section.title: What is a CPU Bottleneck?
cpu_section.subtitle: (The "Bad" Bottleneck)
cpu_section.description: A CPU bottleneck happens when your processor (CPU) cannot process data and instructions fast enough to keep your graphics card (GPU) fully occupied. This is the most common and problematic type of bottleneck for gamers, as it leads to inconsistent performance that can't be fixed by simply lowering graphics settings.
symptoms_list: Stuttering or choppy gameplay, especially during intense action.
Low FPS in CPU-intensive games (Valorant, Counter-Strike 2, strategy titles).
GPU usage is low (60â€“70%) while CPU cores are maxed at 100%.

gpu_section.title: What is a GPU Bottleneck?
gpu_section.subtitle: (The "Good" Bottleneck)
gpu_section.description: A GPU bottleneck, also known as being "GPU limited," occurs when your graphics card is running at full capacity (99â€“100% usage). It dictates your maximum frame rate because itâ€™s working as hard as possible to render visuals.
gpu_section.description_p2: This is generally ideal for gaming. It means youâ€™re fully utilizing your GPU investment, especially in AAA games at 1440p/4K with ultra settings.

action_plan.title: How to Fix a Bottleneck: Your Action Plan
action_plan.description: Once our calculator identifies a bottleneck, here are the most effective steps to address it.

cpu_solutions.title: Tackling a CPU Bottleneck
cpu_solutions.intro: If your CPU is the weak link, reduce its workload or boost its performance.
immediate_fixes_list: Close Background Apps: Shut down browsers/streaming apps before gaming.
Lower CPU-Heavy Settings: Reduce physics, crowd density, view distance.
Increase Resolution: Shifts workload onto the GPU, balancing the load.
long_term_fixes_list: Overclocking: With cooling, expect a 5â€“15% CPU boost.
Upgrade CPU: Choose one that matches your GPU as per calculator results.
cpu_solutions.example_title: Real-World Example: Upgrading Your CPU for a Modern GPU
cpu_solutions.example_desc: A user upgrades to a NVIDIA RTX 4070 but keeps an older Ryzen 5 3600.
cpu_solutions.example_issue: At 1440p/4K it performs decently, but in esports at 1080p, stutters appear regardless of settings.
cpu_solutions.example_solution: The Solution: This is a CPU bottleneck. Upgrading to a Ryzen 5 7600X or Intel Core i5-14600K restores balance, letting the RTX 4070 shine.

gpu_solutions.title: Managing a GPU Bottleneck
gpu_solutions.intro: This is often a good thing. The goal isnâ€™t to remove it, but to tune for your FPS target.
levers_list: Lower GPU settings (textures, shadows, ray tracing).
gpu_solutions.example_title: Real-World Example: Overcoming a Mid-Range GPU Limit
gpu_solutions.example_desc: A Ryzen 5 5600X is paired with an older GTX 1660 Super.
gpu_solutions.example_issue: At 1440p, the CPU can handle the logic, but the GPU maxes out at 100% and struggles to keep smooth FPS.
gpu_solutions.example_solution: The Solution: Upgrade to a RTX 4060 or RX 7700 XT for stable, high-quality 1440p gaming.

final_section.title: How Our Calculator Leads to a Balanced PC
final_section.description: Our tool analyzes component relationships so you donâ€™t have to. By entering your parts, you get instant, data-driven analysis to:
benefits_list: Build Smarter: Avoid pairing a high-end GPU with a weak CPU.
Upgrade with Confidence: Know which part gives biggest gains.
Save Money: Donâ€™t overspend on bottlenecked components.
final_section.cta: Ready to check your build? Use the calculator to ensure your PC is perfectly balanced for performance.

fps_guide.title: Understanding Your Gaming Performance: The FPS Calculator
fps_guide.intro: In the world of PC gaming, Frames Per Second (FPS) is the ultimate measure of performance. It represents how many individual images your computer can display every second, directly translating to the smoothness of your gameplay. A high, stable FPS means a fluid, responsive experience, while a low FPS leads to stuttering and lag.

why_estimate.title: Why Estimate Your FPS?
why_estimate.content: Knowing your potential gaming performance before you buy a new game or upgrade a component is crucial. It empowers you to make informed decisions, manage expectations, and avoid the disappointment of a purchase that your PC can't handle.

how_works.title: How Does the FPS Calculator Work?
how_works.content: Our calculator uses a sophisticated model based on thousands of real-world benchmarks. It considers three key factors:
list: Your CPU's Power: The processor handles the game's logic, physics, and AI. In many eSports titles, the CPU is the primary driver of high frame rates.
Your GPU's Power: The graphics card is responsible for rendering the visuals. In graphically intense AAA titles, the GPU does the heaviest lifting.
Your Target Resolution: Playing at 4K requires your GPU to render four times as many pixels as 1080p, which has a massive impact on the final FPS.

low_fps.title: Low FPS? Your Next Steps to a Better Gaming Experience

step1.title: Step 1: Diagnose the Core Issue with Our Bottleneck Calculator
step1.p1: Before you consider an upgrade, you need to know why your FPS is low. Is your powerful GPU being held back by an older CPU? Or is your GPU simply not strong enough for your desired settings?
step1.p2: Our PC Bottleneck Calculator is the perfect diagnostic tool. It analyzes the synergy between your CPU and GPU to pinpoint the exact weak link in your system.

step2.title: Step 2: Ensure You Have Enough Power for an Upgrade
step2.p1: If you're planning a GPU upgrade to boost your FPS, there's one critical step you can't ignore: your Power Supply Unit (PSU). Modern graphics cards can be very power-hungry.
step2.p2: Use our PSU Wattage Calculator to ensure your power supply can handle any new hardware you're considering.

tips.lock_fps: Lock FPS to your monitor refresh rate for stable experience.
tips.no_rt: Turn off ray tracing at 4K for better performance.
tips.fsr: Use FSR 2.0 to boost FPS without major visual loss.
tips.lower_settings: Lower shadow and texture quality for +10â€“15% FPS boost.

psu_page.title: PSU Calculator - How Much Wattage Does My PC Need? (Free 2026)
psu_page.description: Calculate the recommended power supply (PSU) wattage for your PC build. Select your CPU and GPU to get an estimated load and a safe PSU recommendation.
psu_page.hero_subtitle: Ensure your PC has enough power. Select your core components to get a recommended PSU wattage.
psu_page.interlink_desc: Now, make sure your CPU and GPU are a balanced match for peak performance. An unbalanced system can waste your hardware's potential.
psu_page.faq_subtitle: Quick answers to common questions about choosing the right PSU for your gaming PC.

faqs.q: How does the PSU calculator determine the required wattage?
faqs.a: The PSU calculator estimates wattage by analyzing your CPU, GPU, RAM, storage devices, cooling system, and additional components. It also adds a recommended safety margin for stability and future upgrades.

faqs.q: Is it bad to use a PSU with much higher wattage than needed?
faqs.a: No. A higher-wattage PSU wonâ€™t damage your PC â€” it simply provides extra headroom. Your system only draws what it needs. For best efficiency, aim for 50â€“70% load utilization.

faqs.q: Does PSU efficiency (80 Plus rating) affect gaming performance?
faqs.a: PSU efficiency ratings donâ€™t directly affect FPS. Instead, they show how much power is wasted as heat. A higher efficiency PSU reduces electricity use and helps keep your PC cooler.

faqs.q: Can undervaluing PSU wattage cause hardware damage?
faqs.a: Yes. Using an underpowered PSU may cause crashes, boot failures, or stress components over time. The PSU calculator helps prevent this by recommending the correct wattage for your build.

psu_guide.header_title: PSU Wattage Calculator â€“ Find the Right Power Supply for Your Gaming PC
psu_guide.intro: Choosing the right Power Supply Unit (PSU) is critical for building a stable and future-proof gaming PC. An underpowered PSU can cause crashes, random shutdowns, or even long-term damage to your components. Our PSU Calculator makes it easy to estimate the exact wattage your system needs, whether youâ€™re planning a fresh build or upgrading your graphics card.
psu_guide.why_title: Why Use a PSU Wattage Calculator?
psu_guide.why_desc: Picking a PSU isnâ€™t just about grabbing the highest wattage you can find. Overspending on an unnecessarily powerful PSU wastes money, while underestimating your needs risks system instability. A PSU wattage calculator ensures that you strike the perfect balance between cost, efficiency, and performance.
psu_guide.how_title: How Does the PSU Calculator Work?
psu_guide.how_desc_1: Our tool analyzes the combined power requirements of your CPU, GPU, RAM, storage devices, and peripherals. It then recommends the ideal PSU wattage to prevent bottlenecks and ensure long-term stability. This way, you can buy confidently without overpaying for extra power youâ€™ll never use.
psu_guide.how_desc_2: For the most accurate analysis, pair this tool with our PC Bottleneck Calculator. It identifies weak links in your system so you know whether your next upgrade should be a GPU, CPU, or power supply.
psu_guide.benefits_title: Benefits of Using Our PSU Calculator
benefits_list: Prevent Crashes & Instability: Ensure your PSU can handle your most demanding gaming sessions.
Save Money: Avoid overspending on an unnecessarily high-wattage power supply.
Future-Proof Your Build: Account for upcoming upgrades like GPUs or additional storage.
Peace of Mind: Build a system that runs smoothly under full load without risk.
psu_guide.conclusion_title: Build Smarter with the Right PSU
psu_guide.conclusion_desc: The PSU is the foundation of a reliable gaming rig. With our PSU Wattage Calculator, you can accurately determine how much power your system needs before making a purchase. Pair it with our FPS Calculator to see how your hardware translates into real-world gaming performance and achieve the perfect balance between power and gameplay.
